body.p:
Your petitioners John Raley and W P Downs would state to your Excellency that they are indicted in the Ohio Circuit Court for keeping a tippling house, and they have give a truthful statement of the case. They say that they now doing a very small business in their neighborhood in merchandise. They state that their business was very limited as their means are and now both being in very poor circumstances.They now trading as partners. Like many others they get license to sell as merchants and now mistaken as to the privileges they now entitled to. They say that they get license from Jacob Leach as assessor or made or made application to him and procured the license to sell whiskey from W H Miller. collector both being United states officers. They positively assert that they honestly thought they had the right to sell and did sell publicly and by the glass and otherwise as purchases would want. They state that they asked different persons and they all thought that petitioners had the right to sell and this too was the opinion of the sheriff of the county for they
asked his opinion. They paid twenty dollars to the officers aforesd.

They sold for about three months, dissolved and quit the business and are not now engaged in merchandsing but are at work which they understand better and hope it will prove more profitable. They pray your Excellency for relief. The court is the 4th Monday in March present month. The foregoing is a truthful statement and they do pray your Excellency for relief by the time the court comes.

John ^his X mark^ Raley
W. P. Downs
Sworn to before me this 9th day of March 1864 by John Raley ^W. P. Downs^ but A. L. Morton Clk Ohio Cir Ct

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
